items.title: Beginning of HTML
items.content: Tim Berners-Lee invents HTML 1.0

items.title: HTML 1.0 is released
items.content: Not many developers are creating websites at this time.

items.title: HTML 2.0 is published
items.content: This contains the features of HTML 1.0 plus new features. This remained the standard markup language for designing and creating websites until 1997.

items.title: Introduction of JavaScript
items.content: JavaScript was created for Netscape 2, and it became the standard in 1997. It is well developed because of its advantages such as good compatibility.

items.title: Introduction of Java applet
items.content: Java applets is able to provide animation, dynamic contents, communication with the server, and client-side applications

items.title: iframe tag introduced
items.content: Internet Explorer added iframe tag to HTML, it supports asynchronous refreshing the page.

items.title: HTML 3.0 was invented
items.content: Here, Dave Raggett introduced a fresh draft on HTML, which improved new features of HTML and gave more powerful characteristics for webmasters in designing websites.

items.title: DOM introduced
items.content: DOM stands for Document Object Model. It helps developers to better format HTML files by putting all elements in a DOM tree.

items.title: HTML 4.0 was published
items.content: The widely-used HTML 4.0 comes out. It is very successful.

items.title: Ajax firstly introduced
items.content: The concept of Ajax was firstly introduced, Outlook Web became the first commercial application using Ajax.

items.title: Flash became popular
items.content: Flash has very good performance compared with Java applet back in 2001

items.title: Ajax became widely accepted
items.content: Google started to use asynchronous loading in its applications including Google Maps, Gmail, and Google Search.

items.title: jQuery created
items.content: jQuery is a JavaScript library, and it makes JavaScript coding fun by stripping out all the necessary markup and leaving codes short, and understandable.

items.title: HTML 5 is released
items.content: HTML 5.0 is used worldwide. It is said to be the extended version of HTML 4.01 which was published in 2012.

items.title: AngularJS published by Google
items.content: AngularJS is an open-source web application framework maintained by Google. It aims to enhance MVC mode to bring a clear SPA webpage.

items.title: React made open source by Facebook
items.content: React was originally developed by Facebook as a internal frontend development framework run by JavaScript.

items.title: Vue became available
items.content: Vue is a JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. It provides a declarative and component-based programming model that helps you efficiently develop user interfaces, be it simple or complex.

items.title: End of Java applet
items.content: Java applets were deprecated by Java 9 in 2017.

items.title: First appare of WebAssembly
items.content: WebAssembly allows webs to run binary code and has better performance compared with JavaScript.

items.title: Flash end of life
items.content: Due to many restrictions and security concerns, in 2017, Adobe announced they would stop updating Flash.
